comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This is a rare (?) view of the First Sydney Station Terminus (1855) as described here - www.cityrail.info/about/history/central_station_in-depth . And a glimpse of Sydney's first horse-drawn tramway, from the station along Pitt Street to Circular Quay, see en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trams_in_Sydney#Early_tramways ..

comment._content: Thank you beachcomberaustralia for adding the city rail, link. Marvellous photos of which I'd never seen previous to this! Good of you to do that!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Recently came across another photo of this first Sydney Station. Titled "The Great Southern Railway Station, Sydney" from an album by William Blackwood dated 1858 - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=824169&am... Album - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemdetailpaged.aspx?itemid=404877#
